original_title: Sri Lanka bill yields fall across maturities at auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold 125 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday after offering 125 billion while yields across maturities fell, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 55 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 26.23 percent, down 171 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 55 billion rupees.
All the offered 30 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 26.12 percent, down 121 basis points from a week earlier.
40 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 24.32 percent, down 160 basis points from a week earlier after offering 40 billion. (Colombo/March22/2022)
